result.execSummary:
The defendant William C. Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William C. Taylor is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William C. Taylor was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William C. Taylor

defendant.name: Taylor, William C.

records.addlTxt:
10:31 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant William C. Taylor in court.  Attorney Michal James Peterson in court for William C. Taylor.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Peterson is heard on agreement. States agreement. 
Atty Steiner is heard on agreement. Confirms and states agreement. 
22CM11 - Count 2 to be dismissed and Count 1 to be amended to an ordinance violation of disorderly conduct.  
22CM16 - Count 1 to be amended to an ordinance violation of disorderly conduct.
$100.00 fine for each. Victim witness surcharge to be applied. 

Atty Steiner moves to dismiss count 2 in 22CM11. Count 1 in 22CM11 will be an ordinance violation of disorderly conduct. 
In 22CM16 amend bail jumping charge to an ordinance violation of disorderly conduct. 

Defendant pleads No Contest. Court accepts the No Contest plea and finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders count 2 in 22CM11 to be dismissed. Count 1 in 22CM11 will be an ordinance violation of disorderly conduct. 
In 22CM16 amend bail jumping charge to an ordinance violation of disorderly conduct. 

$100.00 fine plus cost for each ordinance violation.  Total court costs of $263.50. Victim Witness Surcharge of $67.00 for each. Total of $330.50 for each.  Total for both $661.00 

Bond paid of $150.00 each/Total of $300.00 in bond money to be applied.  60DTP.

2:02 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant William C. Taylor in court.  Attorney Michal James Peterson in court for William C. Taylor.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

The original document was titled: Victim Impact Statement
The original history event date is: 03-21-2022

1:52 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant William C. Taylor appeared in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on February 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:17 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant William C Taylor appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause 

DA Requests a $150.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no violent or abusive contact with A.N.L. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court sets bond of $150.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no violent or abusive contact with A.N.L

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no violent or abusive contact with A.N.L
